description: Variation of conditions 2, 4A, 20 and 26 of planning permission dated 12/07/2021 ref 2020/3421 (Alterations including erection of two-storey roof extension, removal of external canopy and refurbishment of building facades, restoration of the roof top cupola, associated cycle parking, landscaping and other ancillary activities, in connection with proposed Class E use (Associated Listed Building Application Ref: 2020/3483)) to allow amendments to the development as in additional rooftop ductwork, an increase in the lift overrun by approx. 300mm, amendments to land use mix, an amendment to suit structural requirements and existing slab levels and installation of a riser from lower ground floor up to the louvres on Ilminster Gardens elevation.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of  the initial permission ref: 2020/3421 (dated: 07/04/2021).
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [4459-ST-XX-XX-PL-A-EX-01-002, 4459-ST-XX-B1-PL-A-PD-02-009 rev 1,  4459-ST-XX-00-PL-A-PD-02-010 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-01-PL-A-PD-02-011 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-02-PL-A-PD-02-012 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-03-PL-A-PD-02-013 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-04-PL-A-PD-02-014 rev 0, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-DM-03-001 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PD-03-002 rev 0, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PD-03-003 rev 0, 4459-ST-XX-XX-SX-ADM-04-001 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XX-SX-A-DM-04-002 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XXPL-A-PR-01-001 rev 3, 4459-ST-XX- XX-PL-A-PL-01-500 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-B1-PL-A-PL-02-009 rev 3, 4459-ST-XX-00-PL-A-PL-02-010 rev 4, 4459-STXX-01-PL-A-PL-02-011 rev 2, 4459-ST-XX-02-PL-A-PL-02-012 rev 2, 4459-ST-XX-03-PL-A-PL-02-013 rev 2, 4459-ST-XX-04-PL-A-PL-02-014 rev 2, 4459-ST-XX-05-PL-A-PL-02-015 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-05-PL-A-PL-02-016 rev 2, 4459-ST-XX-06-PL-A-PR-27-002 rev 15, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-03-001 rev 5, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-03-002 rev 4, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-03-003 rev 3, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-03-010 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XX-SX-A-PL-04-001 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XX-SX-A-PL-04-002 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XX-SX-A-PL-04-010 rev 0, 4459-ST-XX-XX-SX-A-PL-04-011 rev 0, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PR-95-012 rev 02, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PR-95-013 rev 0, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PR-95-014 rev 0, 4459-ST-XX-XX-ELA-PL-31- 020 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-021 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XXEL-A-PL-31-022 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31- 023 rev 1, 4459-ST-XXXX-EL-A-PL-31-024 rev 1, 4459-ST-XXXX- EL-A-PL-31-025 rev 2, 4459-STXX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-040 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-050 rev 0, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-060 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XX-PL-A-PL-07-300 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-00-PL-A-PL-02-310 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-001 rev 4, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-350, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-360 rev 3,  4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-361 rev 4, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-362 rev 4, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-363 rev 4, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-365 rev 4,   4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-370 re

Condition : 3 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the materials as approved under application ref: 2021/4903 (dated: 21/04/2022) and thereafter so retained. 
Reason: In order to assess the suitability of the proposed materials, in the interests of the appearance of the locality, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 and DMS2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.  It is necessary for the condition to be discharged prior to the commencement of works to ensure suitable materials are used in the construction.

Condition : 4 - A) The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved shopfront design details as provided under application ref: 2022/2278 (dated: 26/07/2022) [Sample - Zimbabwe Black Honey RL-SAM-.007 (Sample ref: KH-SAM-0048, Spec/Code ref: H51.103), Sample - Travertine Cross Cut Filled & Polished (Sample ref: KH-AH-SAM-0113 KH-SAM-RL-0010, Spec/Code ref: EWS-802), Sample - Hartham Park Bath Stone: Sample No. 2739 T1 (Sample ref: KH-AH-SAM-0042 KH-SAM-OAG-0006, Spec/Code ref: H51.103)] and revised drawings numbers [4459-ST-XX-00-PL-A-PL-02-010 rev 4,  4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-001 rev 4,  4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-300 rev 4,  4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-350, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-360 rev 3,  4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-361 rev 4, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-362 rev 4, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-363 rev 4, 4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-365 rev 4,   4459-ST-XX-XX-EL-A-PL-31-370 rev 1]. The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details and retained as such. 
Reason: To ensure a high quality of development and to accord with policies DMS1and DMS2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.


B) The development shall be carried out in accordance with the material specifications for the replacement ground floor shopfronts as approved under application ref: 2021/2412 (dated: 17/08/2021) and thereafter so retained. 
Reason: To ensure a high quality of development and to accord with policies DMS1and DMS2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 5 - A) The development shall be carried out in accordance with the external restoration method statement and materials as approved under application ref: 2021/2877 (dated: 06/10/2021) and thereafter so retained.
Reason: In order to assess the suitability of the proposed materials, in the interests of the appearance of the locality, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 and DMS2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.


B) The development shall be carried out in accordance with the internal restoration method statement and materials as approved under application ref: 2022/1159 (dated: 13/06/2022), and thereafter so retained. 
Reason: In order to assess the suitability of the proposed materials, in the interests of the appearance of the locality, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 and DMS2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.)

Condition : 6 - The development shall be constructed in accordance with the details of the protective enclosures to the existing barrel and stain-glass dome roof features as approved under application ref: 2021/5520 (dated: 31/01/2022) and retained as such.
Reason: To ensure a high quality of development and to accord with policies DMS1and DMS2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 7 - Prior to the occupation of the development the windows in the east elevation at fourth and fifth floor level of the development shall be obscure-glazed and non-opening (unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed).  The windows shall so be maintained and retained as such. 
Reason: To control overlooking and safeguard the privacy of neighbours in accordance with Council policy DMS1(c) of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 8 - All external ventilation equipment shall be installed in accordance with the approved details under application ref: 2021/4200 (dated: 08/12/2021) prior to the commencement of the use and thereafter be so operated and maintained. 
Reason: In the interests of neighbour amenity and visual appearance, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 9 - All external and internal lighting, and any means of illumination of the site, shall be installed in accordance with details approved under application ref: 2022/1089 (dated 22/07/2022) prior to the commencement of the use and thereafter be so operated and maintained. 
Reason: In the interests of neighbour amenity and visual appearance, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.
Reason: To preserve residential amenities of the locality and protect the biodiversity of the area in accordance with DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 10 - The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the Dust Management Plan (DMP) as approved under application ref: 2021/1739 (dated: 21/06/2021).
Reason: To manage and prevent further deterioration of existing low-quality air across London in accordance with London Plan policy 5.3 and 7.14, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of para. 181 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 11 - All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) used during the course of the development that is within the scope of the Greater London Authority 'Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition' Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) dated July 2014, or any subsequent amendment or guidance, shall comply with the emission requirements therein.
Reason: To manage and prevent further deterioration of existing low-quality air across London in accordance with London Plan policy 5.3 and 7.14, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of para. 181 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 12 - Parameters of the PM10 continuous monitoring to be monitored, duration, locations and monitoring techniques must be undertaken in accordance with details approved under application ref: 2021/1739 (dated: 21/06/2021) prior to commencement of monitoring.  
Reason: To manage and prevent further deterioration of existing low-quality air across London in accordance with London Plan policy 5.3 and 7.14, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of para. 181 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 13 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the preliminary risk assessment approved under application ref: 2021/1742 (dated: 07/06/2021).
Reason: To ensure that environmental risks have been satisfactorily managed so that the site is deemed suitable for residential use to accord with Council policies IS4 and DMH4 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 14 - Prior to first occupation of the development, a verification report demonstrating completion of the remediation set out in the approved remediation statement and the effectiveness of the remediation shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The report shall include results of sampling and monitoring completed out to demonstrate that the site remediation criteria for residential use have been met.  
Reason: To ensure that remedial measures have been undertaken and the environmental risks have been satisfactorily managed so that the site is deemed suitable for residential use to accord with Council policies IS4 and DMH4 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 15 - Prior to first occupation of the development, secure and covered cycle parking shall be provided in accordance with the approved details under application ref: 2022/3690 (dated 21/12/2023) prior to the occupation of the development and be retained for cycle parking purposes for the users of the development and for no other purpose.
Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for cycle parking in accordance with Council policy DMT2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 16 - Prior to the first occupation of the development herby permitted, a travel plan shall be submitted for approval in writing by the local planning authority and the plan implemented in accordance with the findings of the approved transport assessment. The approved travel plan shall remain in operation thereafter.
Reason: To reduce single occupancy car journeys and encourage the use of public transport in accordance with Council Policies DMS1, DMT1 and DMT2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 17 - The demolition and construction works shall be carried out in accordance with the construction and logistics management plan as approved under application ref: 2021/1741 (dated: 03/08/2021).
Reason: In the interests of traffic, general amenity of the area and neighbour amenity in accordance with Council policy DMT1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. It is necessary for the condition to be discharged prior to the commencement of any works on site to ensure the whole construction phase is in accordance with an approved plan.

Condition : 18 - Prior to first occupation of the development, details of internal waste and recycling storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The submitted details shall include arrangement specifications for the collection of waste from the development. The approved details shall be installed prior to first occupation of the development and operated and maintained in perpetuity.
Reason: To ensure adequate refuse storage is provided on site and can be readily collected, to accord with Council policies DMS1 and DMT2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 19 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the breeding bird survey as approved under application ref: 2021/1743 (Dated: 14/07/2021).
Reason: To prevent harm to biodiversity in accordance with Council policy DMO4a of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition : 20 - All measures to provide biodiversity gain on site shall be installed in accordance with details as provided under application ref: 2022/1081 (dated: 14/09/2022) [AH134.P.11.MPS rev C3, AH134.D.01.BRD rev C3, AH134.P.06.TTP rev C2, AH134.P.08.RPP2 rev C2, AH134.P.07.RPP1 rev C2, AH134.D.08.LSR rev T3, Cover letter (ref: DP5412/TS/KG, dated: 14/03/2022), Consultant Advice Notice (Project No: 14183 - 002, dated: 18/01/2022), Design Note - Impact of External Lighting on Biodiversity Features (July 2022).] and revised drawings numbers [4459-ST-XX-06-PL-A-PR-27-002 rev 15, AH134.P.01.RP rev P4] prior to the occupation of the site and thereafter maintained.
Reason: to provide biodiversity gain in accordance with Council policy DMO4b of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 21 - Prior to the commencement of the use of the flat roof as a roof terrace development at 4-storey roof level (excluding demolition of existing roof level structures hereby approved), a landscaping scheme to include landscaping, surface and boundary treatments to the proposed roof terrace and east elevation ground floor lightwell, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. These details shall include hard landscaping works including proposed finished levels and contours, pedestrian access and
circulation areas; hard surfacing materials; the lighting column design, height and materials; soft landscaping including the species and height of tree planting and root volumes, shrubs, plants and seeding; green roof specification; bat and bird boxes; minor artefacts and structures (e.g. furniture equipment, refuse or other storage units, signs, lighting); proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (e.g. drainage power; communications cables, pipelines, indicating lines, supports); retained historic features and proposals for restoration. The landscaping scheme shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and completed prior to the occupation of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed in writing with the local planning authority.
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance, provide tree planting and biodiversity improvements, in accordance with Council policies DMS1, and DMO4 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. The details are required prior to the commencement of works to ensure the landscaping measures are incorporated in the layout and construction of the development.

Condition : 22 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of the extent and location of Japanese Knotweed and management plan as approved under application ref: 2021/1744 (dated: 07/06/2021).
Reason: to prevent harm to biodiversity in accordance with Council policy DMO4 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition : 23 - The development shall be built in accordance with the submitted Energy Strategy [Sustainability and Energy Statement (2/09/2020)] demonstrating how the development will follow the hierarchy of energy efficiency, decentralised energy and renewable energy technologies to secure a minimum 35% reduction in CO2 emissions below the maximum threshold set in Building Regulations Part L 2013. Prior to first occupation of the development, evidence (e.g. photographs, copies of installation contracts and as-built worksheets prepared under SAP or the National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the local planning authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy. The installed measures shall be retained in accordance with the approved details unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority.
Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and to accord with London Plan policy 5.2 and Council policy DMS3 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 24 - The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Excellent rating under the BREEAM Interim (Design Stage) Assessment as submitted under application ref: 2022/2878 (dated 01/09/2022).
Reason: To achieve appropriate sustainability standards in accordance with Council policy DMS3 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 25 - Within three months of the occupation of the building a BREEAM New Construction Final (Post-Construction) Certificate, issued by the BRE (or equivalent accredited body), shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to demonstrate that an Excellent rating has been achieved. All the measures integrated shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence.
Reason: To achieve appropriate sustainability standards in accordance with Council policy DMS3 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 26 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) or any Order revoking, amending and re-enacting the Order the development hereby approved be used only for commercial, business and service uses (Class E) and for no other purpose. Zone A as specified within the details hereby approved [Cover Letter (ref: TS/ZS/DP5412, dated: 05/08/2022), Arding & Hobbs Tenant Mix , 4459-ST-XX-XX-PL-A-PL-07-300 rev 1, 4459-ST-XX-B1-PL-A-PL-02-009 rev 3, 4459-STXX-00-PL-A-PL-02-010 rev 3] shall be used in accordance with the percentage split of the referenced uses (minimum 39% of GIA of Class E(a) retail at ground floor) and for no other purposes (including any other purpose in Class E of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without 9 Official modification). 
Reason: To order to protect the vitality and viability of the core shopping frontage, and to safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood by ensuring that other uses which could cause a loss of amenity do not commence without prior approval in accordance with policies DMS1, DMTS1 and DMTS3 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 27 - The photovoltaic panels shall be installed in accordance with the approved details under application ref: 2022/0369 (dated 31/03/2022) prior to the occupation of the development and retained and maintained as such unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority.
Reason: to achieve appropriate sustainability standard and in the interest of local visual amenity, in accordance with Council policies DMS1, DMS2 and DMS3 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.To achieve appropriate sustainability standard and in the interest of local visual amenity, in accordance with Council policies DMS1, DMS2 and DMS3 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Condition : 28 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
